data: Fragment of a thick plaque or stele of limestone. Intact on the left and part of the front and rear face, but broken top, bottom, and on the right. A substantial raised moulding is partially preserved along the left side, which could originally have been a relief carving of an engaged column, but has a flat / smooth front survace. Part of the upper right of the preserved face is also lost.

Remains of 16 densely packed lines of Greek, with the left margin intact; the faint suggestion of a raised border in the lower left corner implies that the final line preserved may be the final line of the text.

Deep cut, small regular square letters, without serifs. Alpha has broken bar; omicron is full size; omega is closed, smaller circle atop a horizontal bar; theta slightly ovoid; sigma has horizontal top and bottom strokes.
Area of the bouleuterion, S. Nicola
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered at the site of Agrigento and in Agrigento province, organised both by chronology and type across a number of rooms and corridors
Contrada San Nicola, 12 Valley of the Temples, 92100 - Agrigento (AG)
S. Calderone, «Frammento di decreto onorifico agrigentino», Quaderni dell’Istituto di Archeologia della Facolta di Lettere e Filosofia dell’Universita di Messina 1 (1985): 13–18
Tre iscrizioni di Agrigento. Il culto dei Caesares nipoti di Augusto e la diffusione della gens Annia
Giacomo Manganaro, «Tre iscrizioni di Agrigento. Il culto dei Caesares nipoti di Augusto e la diffusione della gens Annia», Sicilia Antiqua 10 (2013): 247–52
Rivangando iscrizioni siceliote e monete imperiali con contromarche e incisioni
Giacomo Manganaro, «Rivangando iscrizioni siceliote e monete imperiali con contromarche e incisioni», Epigraphica 76 (2014): 63–80
Calderone, 1985, Frammento di decreto onorifico agrigentino
Manganaro, 2013, Tre iscrizioni di Agrigento. Il culto dei Caesares nipoti di Augusto e la diffusione della gens Annia
Manganaro, 2014, Rivangando iscrizioni siceliote e monete imperiali con contromarche e incisioni

Fragment of a thick plaque or stele of limestone. Intact on the left and part of the front and rear face, but broken top, bottom, and on the right. A substantial raised moulding is partially preserved along the left side, which could originally have been a relief carving of an engaged column, but has a flat / smooth front survace. Part of the upper right of the preserved face is also lost.

limestone stele 13.5 (maximum preserved; 16 at rear) 14.5 (maximum preserved; 14.7 at rear) 8.5

Remains of 16 densely packed lines of Greek, with the left margin intact; the faint suggestion of a raised border in the lower left corner implies that the final line preserved may be the final line of the text.

chiselled

Deep cut, small regular square letters, without serifs. Alpha has broken bar; omicron is full size; omega is closed, smaller circle atop a horizontal bar; theta slightly ovoid; sigma has horizontal top and bottom strokes.
